en: We used to visit each other on weekends.
zh: 我们过去常常在周末互相拜访。

en: We used to visit each other on the weekend.
zh: 我们过去常常在周末互相拜访。

en: See you on the weekend.
zh: 周末见。

en: Let's go hiking this weekend.
zh: 这个周末我们去徒步旅行吧。

en: How about going to a disco this weekend?
zh: 这个周末去迪斯科舞厅怎么样？

en: Let's visit my grandpa this weekend.
zh: 这个周末我们去拜访我的爷爷吧。

en: As long as it doesn't spoil the weekend!
zh: 只要不破坏周末就好！

en: Will you have a little time this weekend to help me with my French?

en: I sure wish I could have a three-day weekend.
zh: 我真希望有个三天的小长假。

en: Is there a weekly rate?
zh: 有周租价吗？

en: You should receive them by the end of the week.
zh: 你应该在本周末之前收到它们。

en: The latter half of the week was fine.
zh: 这周后半段还可以。

en: The seventh day of the week is Saturday.
zh: 一周的第七天是星期六。

en: The 7th day of the week is Saturday.
zh: 一周的第七天是星期六。

en: We have four French classes a week.
zh: 我们一周有四节法语课。

en: How many times a week do you take a bath?

en: How many times a week does the soccer team practice?
zh: 足球队一周练习几次？

en: Try to exercise at least once a week.

en: Studying three hours a week wouldn't be enough to learn a language well.
zh: 每周学习三个小时不足以学好一门语言。

en: When attacked he defended himself with an umbrella.
zh: 受到攻击时，他用雨伞自卫。

en: The number of minority seats in the Lower House is rapidly eroding.
zh: 众议院少数席位的数量正在迅速减少。

en: The boat is lost.
zh: 船迷路了。

en: Courage is needed to change a custom.
zh: 改变习俗需要勇气。

en: Habit is second nature.
zh: 习惯成自然。

en: Custom reconciles us to everything.
zh: 习惯使我们对一切都习以为常。

en: A habit is very difficult to shake off once it is formed.
zh: 习惯一旦养成，就很难改掉。

en: It is true of learning English that "practice makes perfect".
zh: 学英语确实是“熟能生巧”。

en: His English is not bad, seeing that he has studied for only two years.
zh: 考虑到他只学了两年，他的英语算是不错了。

en: We are just in time for the last train.
zh: 我们正好赶上最后一班火车。

en: It rained on and off all day.
zh: 今天断断续续下了一天的雨。

en: Many passengers were sleeping on the last train.
zh: 很多乘客在最后一班火车上睡觉。

en: I have to hurry to the station to take the last train.
zh: 我得赶紧去车站赶最后一班火车。

en: I have to hurry to the station to catch the last train.
zh: 我得赶紧去车站赶最后一班火车。

en: I was able to catch the last train.
zh: 我赶上了最后一班火车。

en: It is difficult to find a well paid permanent job.
zh: 很难找到一份待遇优厚的长期工作。

en: Go out and have a good time once in a while instead of just studying all the time.
zh: 偶尔出去玩玩，别老是学习。

en: What time does the curtain fall?

en: All's well that ends well.
zh: 结局好，一切都好。

en: All is well that ends well.
zh: 结局好，一切都好。

en: I'll mail this questionnaire as soon as I finish.
zh: 我一完成就寄出这份问卷。

en: You must try hard to the end.
zh: 你必须努力到最后。

en: "I've finished" said Tony shortly, then he closed the piano.
zh: “我完成了，”托尼简短地说，然后他关上了钢琴。

en: Have you finished?
zh: 你完成了吗？

en: Autumnal Equinox Day falls on Friday this year.
zh: 今年的秋分节在星期五。

en: An autumn breeze begins to blow.
zh: 秋风开始吹了。

en: Like a leaf in the autumn breeze.
zh: 像秋风中的一片叶子。

en: I prefer spring to fall.
zh: 我喜欢春天胜过秋天。

en: There are also people who like spring better than autumn.
zh: 也有人喜欢春天胜过秋天。

en: Autumn is the best season for reading.
zh: 秋天是读书的最佳季节。

en: Fall is a good season for reading.
zh: 秋天是读书的好季节。

en: It goes without saying that autumn is the best season for taking long walks in the country.

en: Autumn weather is changeable.

en: Autumn is when food is especially delicious.
zh: 秋天是食物特别美味的季节。

en: Fall is the best season for us to study.
zh: 秋天是我们学习的最佳季节。

en: Fall is when we can study best.
zh: 秋天是我们学习效率最高的季节。

en: The moon is beautiful in fall.

en: Autumn is just around the corner. It's about time the weather started cooling off.
zh: 秋天就要到了。天气也该开始凉快了。

en: Autumn is just around the corner.
zh: 秋天就要到了。

en: Fall is the best season for sports.

en: Autumn changed into winter.

en: Fall has flown by.

en: I think autumn is the most beautiful season of the year.
zh: 我认为秋天是一年中最美的季节。

en: There's nothing better than reading in the long autumn nights.

en: The autumn sky is clear and serene.

en: In the fall, the leaves turn red and gold.

en: In autumn, leaves change their color and fall.

en: In autumn, leaves change color and fall.
zh: 秋天，树叶会改变颜色并落下。

en: The leaves fall in autumn.
zh: 秋天，树叶会落下。

en: Leaves fall in the autumn.
zh: 秋天，树叶会落下。

en: Leaves collect on the sidewalk in the fall.
zh: 秋天，树叶会堆积在人行道上。

en: The leaves fall to the earth in autumn.
zh: 秋天，树叶落到地上。

en: The leaves turn in autumn.
zh: 秋天，树叶会变色。

en: In the fall, many birds head for the south.
zh: 秋天，许多鸟儿飞往南方。

en: Several typhoons hit Japan in autumn.
zh: 秋季，有几次台风袭击了日本。

en: In autumn, leaves fall from trees.
zh: 秋天，树叶从树上掉落。

en: In the autumn, leaves fall from trees.
zh: 秋天，树叶从树上掉落。

en: In autumn the leaves turn yellow.
zh: 秋天，树叶变黄。

en: The leaves change color in autumn.
zh: 秋天，树叶改变颜色。

en: The leaves on the trees change color in the autumn.

en: The leaves on the trees change color in the fall.
zh: 秋天，树上的叶子改变颜色。

en: In fall they go back to school.
zh: 秋天他们回到学校。

en: In the fall, when the days grew shorter and the nights colder, she watched the first frost turn the leaves to bright yellow and orange and red.
zh: 秋天，当白天越来越短，夜晚越来越冷的时候，她看着第一场霜把树叶变成鲜艳的黄色、橙色和红色。

en: The whole mountain turns red in autumn.
zh: 秋天，整座山都变红了。

en: Autumn is here.
zh: 秋天到了。

en: Autumn came and the leaves started to fall.
zh: 秋天来了，树叶开始落下。

en: It goes without saying that autumn is the best season for study.
zh: 不用说，秋天是最适合学习的季节。

en: The repair bill includes parts and labor.
zh: 维修账单包括零件和人工费。

en: The repairs will cost at least 20 pounds.
zh: 修理至少要花20英镑。

en: Take it to a mechanic, and get it fixed.
zh: 把它送到修理工那里，修好它。

en: The mechanic assembled the engine.

en: Repairs will cost a lot of money.
zh: 修理要花很多钱。

en: I think it needs a tune-up.
zh: 我觉得它需要调整一下。

en: When she became a nun, she took the name Sister Teresa.
zh: 当她成为修女时，她取名为特蕾莎修女。

en: The hooded clouds, like friars, tell their beads in drops of rain.
zh: 像修士一样的罩云，在雨滴中数着念珠。

en: I had a lot of pillow fights during my school trip.
zh: 在我的学校旅行中，我有很多枕头大战。

en: The governor set the prisoners free.
zh: 州长释放了囚犯。

en: The governor took the money out of a slush fund.
zh: 州长从秘密基金中取出了钱。

en: The state government deprived the civil rights of their citizen.
zh: 州政府剥夺了其公民的公民权利。

en: State police spokeswoman Janet Welp says the truck wound up crashing into a bridge railing along Interstate 30.
zh: 州警察女发言人珍妮特·韦尔普说，卡车最终撞上了30号州际公路上的桥梁栏杆。

en: The team played hard because the championship of the state was at stake.
zh: 球队努力比赛，因为州冠军至关重要。

en: The Council Education Committee wants to close a school, but some people don't agree with the idea.
zh: 市议会教育委员会想要关闭一所学校，但有些人不同意这个想法。

en: I talk in my sleep very often.
zh: 我经常说梦话。

en: I was interviewed for a job.
zh: 我参加了一个工作的面试。

en: The job-seeking season is starting earlier each year and it's the mass media that are causing that trend by moving up their job interview schedule.
zh: 求职季每年都开始得越来越早，而大众媒体通过提前他们的面试时间表，导致了这一趋势。

en: The company has unofficially decided to employ me.
zh: 公司已经非正式地决定雇用我。

en: A conservative tie is preferable to a loud one for a job interview.
zh: 在面试时，保守的领带比花哨的领带更受欢迎。

en: Admission is free for preschool children.
zh: 学龄前儿童免费入场。

en: On the religious side, the decision caused serious dissension among followers.
zh: 在宗教方面，这个决定在信徒中引起了严重的分歧。

en: Some people don't believe in any religion.
zh: 有些人不相信任何宗教。

en: My mother's religion helped her to come to terms with my father's death.
zh: 我母亲的宗教信仰帮助她接受了我父亲的去世。

en: Religion is the opium of the people.

en: I don't believe in religion.
zh: 我不相信宗教。

en: The bishop took pity on the desperate immigrants.
zh: 主教怜悯了那些绝望的移民。

en: Slaves find power in religion.
zh: 奴隶在宗教中找到了力量。

en: In religion there are the two great motives of fear and love.
zh: 在宗教中，存在着恐惧和爱这两种伟大的动机。

en: She has no opinion about religion.
zh: 她对宗教没有任何看法。

en: You'd better avoid discussion of religion and politics.
zh: 你最好避免讨论宗教和政治。

en: In the religious-cult trial, the ambitious lawyer will represent the cult leader.
zh: 在宗教邪教审判中，雄心勃勃的律师将代表邪教领袖。

en: Be kind to those around you.
zh: 善待你周围的人。

en: The surrounding hills protected the town.
zh: 周围的群山保护着这座城镇。

en: Nothing can change the look of a city so dramatically as the sudden appearance of a block of offices which towers above all the surrounding buildings.
zh: 没有什么能像突然出现的一栋高耸于周围所有建筑之上的办公楼那样，如此戏剧性地改变一座城市的面貌。

en: There was nobody about.

en: He looked quite happy in contrast with those around him.

en: Compared to those around him, he looked really happy.
zh: 和周围的人相比，他看起来非常高兴。

en: The circumstances gave color to her story.
zh: 这些情况为她的故事增添了色彩。

en: The people standing around were amused and laughed at the brave little dog.
zh: 周围站着的人们觉得有趣，都嘲笑那只勇敢的小狗。

en: The people standing around were all strangers.
zh: 周围站着的人都是陌生人。

en: It's noisy around here, so speak a little louder.
zh: 这附近很吵，所以说话声音大一点。

en: The bribery scandal cast doubts on the government.
zh: 这起贿赂丑闻使人们对政府产生了怀疑。

en: The bribery scandal created a backlash overseas.
zh: 这起贿赂丑闻在海外引起了强烈反弹。

en: The bribery came to light.
zh: 这起贿赂事件曝光了。

en: Try to live within your means.
zh: 尽量量入为出。

en: He lives above his means.

en: Do not live above your income.
zh: 不要入不敷出。

en: You must not live beyond your means.
zh: 你一定不要入不敷出。

en: Never spend in excess of your income.
zh: 永远不要超支你的收入。

en: Don't anticipate your income.

en: You should live within your means.
zh: 你应该量入为出。

en: You ought to work hard regardless of your income.
zh: 无论收入多少，你都应该努力工作。

en: You should try to live within your means.
zh: 你应该尽量量入为出。

en: You'll have to proportion your expenditure to your income.
zh: 你必须根据你的收入来安排你的支出。

en: A small income obliges us to thrift.
zh: 收入微薄迫使我们节俭。

en: His large income enabled him to live in comfort.
zh: 他丰厚的收入使他能够过上舒适的生活。

en: The more you earn, the more you spend.
zh: 你挣得越多，花得越多。

en: It is out of the question for me to built a new house till my income becomes greater.
zh: 在我的收入增加之前，我不可能建造新房子。

en: My income has gone down by 10 percent.
zh: 我的收入下降了百分之十。

en: It's difficult for our income to keep up with inflation.
zh: 我们的收入很难赶上通货膨胀。

en: A dry spell accounts for the poor crop.
zh: 长期干旱导致农作物歉收。

en: Because of the poor harvest, wheat prices have gone up in the last six months.
zh: 由于收成不好，过去六个月小麦价格上涨。

en: I began driving our tractor when I was 12 years old to help my father out at harvest time.
zh: 我12岁就开始开拖拉机，在收割季节帮我父亲的忙。

en: The prisoner broke away from the guards who were holding him.
zh: 囚犯挣脱了看守他的警卫。

en: If the harvest gets any worse, there could be a famine.
zh: 如果收成再差下去，可能会发生饥荒。

en: The prisoner escaped from prison.
zh: 囚犯越狱了。

en: The prisoner was set at liberty.
zh: 囚犯被释放了。

en: The prisoner was given his freedom.
zh: 囚犯获得了自由。

en: The prisoner is being quiet in the cell today.
zh: 今天囚犯在牢房里很安静。

en: The prisoner died under torture.
zh: 囚犯在酷刑下死亡。

en: The prisoner denied that he had killed a policeman.
zh: 囚犯否认他杀害了一名警察。

en: The prisoner dug a hole under the prison wall.
zh: 囚犯在监狱墙下挖了一个洞。

en: The inmate was doing time for a burglary conviction.
zh: 这名囚犯因入室盗窃罪正在服刑。

en: The prisoners were glad to be free again.
zh: 囚犯们很高兴再次获得自由。

en: The prisoners are in chains.
zh: 囚犯们戴着镣铐。

en: The prisoners were treated with monstrous cruelty.
zh: 囚犯们受到了极其残酷的对待。

en: A convict has escaped from prison.
zh: 一名罪犯从监狱逃脱了。

en: The supply-demand balance is tight.
zh: 供需平衡紧张。

en: There is close relationship between supply and demand.
zh: 供需之间存在密切关系。

en: As the demand increases, prices go up.
zh: 随着需求的增加，价格上涨。

en: The supply-demand balance is relaxing.
zh: 供需平衡正在放松。

en: Trees give off oxygen and absorb carbon dioxide.
zh: 树木释放氧气并吸收二氧化碳。

en: Trees are cut down and land is cleared.
zh: 树木被砍伐，土地被清理。

en: With no supply of water from trees, rainfalls diminish in time and the area keeps drying up.
zh: 由于没有树木提供水源，降雨量会随着时间的推移而减少，该地区会持续干旱。

en: Extract an essence from the bark of a tree.
zh: 从树皮中提取精华。

en: Tuition fees must be paid not later than the 25th of this month.
zh: 学费必须在本月25号之前缴纳。

en: Be quiet during the lesson.
zh: 上课时请保持安静。

en: Don't talk to others during the class.
zh: 上课时不要和别人说话。

en: During the class she fell asleep in spite of herself.
zh: 上课时她不由自主地睡着了。

en: I do not allow sleeping in class.
zh: 我不允许在课堂上睡觉。

en: Sleeping in class is not allowed.
zh: 不允许在课堂上睡觉。

en: I don't allow sleeping in class.
zh: 我不允许在课堂上睡觉。

en: Sleeping in class isn't allowed.
zh: 不允许在课堂上睡觉。

en: You must not talk to each other in class.
zh: 上课时你们不可以互相交谈。

en: Paying attention in class may lead to high marks.
zh: 上课认真听讲可能会取得高分。

en: Classes begin next Tuesday.
zh: 下周二开始上课。

en: The classes stopped at noon, when we had lunch.
zh: 课程在中午停止了，然后我们吃了午饭。

en: School begins at half past eight in the morning.
zh: 学校早上八点半开始上课。

en: School begins at 8:30 a.m.
zh: 学校早上八点半开始上课。

en: The class was carried on in English.
zh: 这门课是用英语进行的。

en: School is over now.
zh: 现在放学了。

en: School begins at 9.
zh: 学校九点开始上课。

en: School begins at half past eight.
zh: 学校八点半开始上课。

en: School starts at 8:40.
zh: 学校8点40分开始上课。

en: School begins on April 5th.
zh: 学校4月5号开学。

en: You should have prepared for the lesson.
zh: 你应该为这节课做好准备。

en: At the end of the class, the teacher said, "That's enough for today."
zh: 下课时，老师说：“今天就到这里吧。”

en: Will you hand in your essays at the end of the lesson?
zh: 你们会在下课时交论文吗？

en: Don't speak in the middle of a lesson.
zh: 上课时不要说话。

en: We'll be late for class.
zh: 我们上课要迟到了。

en: If you want to go there in time, you'd better make a bee-line for your class right away.
zh: 如果你想及时赶到那里，最好现在立刻以最快的速度去教室。

en: Look up words in advance, before you attend a class.
zh: 上课前，提前查阅单词。

en: It is important to be punctual for your class.
zh: 上课准时很重要。

en: As soon as the lesson was over, they rushed out of the room.
zh: 一下课，他们就冲出了房间。

en: The class being over, the students left quickly.
zh: 下课后，学生们迅速离开了。

en: The lesson being over, children ran out into the hall.
zh: 下课后，孩子们跑到了大厅里。

en: As the lessons were over, the children went home.
zh: 下课后，孩子们回家了。

en: Now that school is over, you can go home.
zh: 现在放学了，你可以回家了。

en: When class is over, it will probably be raining.
zh: 下课的时候，可能要下雨了。

en: When class is over, it'll probably be raining.
zh: 下课的时候，可能要下雨了。

en: How about trying some sushi?
zh: 要不要尝尝寿司？

en: I'll treat you to sushi.
zh: 我请你吃寿司。

en: I don't feel like eating sushi.
zh: 我不想吃寿司。

en: I don't like sushi.
zh: 我不喜欢寿司。

en: I hate sushi.
zh: 我讨厌寿司。

en: Do you like sushi?

en: The spell was broken and the pig turned into a man.
zh: 咒语解除了，猪变成了人。

en: Magic plays an important part in primitive society.

zh: 奇怪的噪音一直从接收器里传来，停不下来。

en: Please ask at the information desk.

en: You have to fill out an application for admission to the hospital at the front desk.
zh: 你必须在前台填写一份入院申请表。

en: The reception isn't good.
zh: 信号不好。

en: There might have been an error during transmission.
zh: 传输过程中可能出现了错误。

en: My fight in our examination hell is over!
zh: 我在考试地狱中的战斗结束了！

en: I failed the tests.
zh: 我考试不及格。

en: I sat for the exam, only to fail.
zh: 我参加了考试，结果却没通过。

en: The receptionist said to come right in.
zh: 接待员说直接进来就行。

en: The receptionist forced me to sign my name on the paper.
zh: 接待员强迫我在纸上签名。

en: I don't know whether to accept or refuse.
zh: 我不知道是接受还是拒绝。

en: Would this be acceptable to you?
zh: 这对您来说可以接受吗？

en: Please let me know when you receive them.
zh: 收到后请告诉我。

en: The coffee mill that I received does not work.
zh: 我收到的咖啡磨不工作。

en: It's hard for nurses to be objective about their patients.
zh: 护士很难对他们的病人保持客观。

en: An injury is much sooner forgotten than an insult.
zh: 身体上的伤害比侮辱更容易被遗忘。

en: The summit conference made a contribution to the peace of the world.
zh: 首脑会议为世界和平做出了贡献。

en: The summit talks are to be broadcast simultaneously throughout the world.
zh: 首脑会谈将在全球同步播出。

en: The summit talks are to be broadcast around the globe.
zh: 首脑会谈将在全球播出。

en: The summit conference was held for world peace.
zh: 首脑会议是为了世界和平而举行的。

en: Leaders are trying to do away with impediments to economic growth.
zh: 领导人正试图消除经济增长的障碍。

en: The capital was bombed again and again.
zh: 首都一次又一次地遭到轰炸。

en: Rwandan rebels are pushing their offensive south as fighting continues in the capital Kigali.
zh: 随着在首都基加利的战斗持续，卢旺达叛军正在向南推进攻势。

en: The Prime Minister will go on the air tomorrow.
zh: 首相明天将发表电视讲话。

en: The Prime Minister holds a press conference tomorrow.
zh: 首相明天将举行新闻发布会。

en: The Prime Minister will hold a press conference tomorrow.
zh: 首相明天将举行新闻发布会。

en: The Prime Minister met with the press.
zh: 首相会见了媒体。

en: The Prime Minister is to make a statement today.
zh: 首相今天将发表声明。

en: The Prime Minister appointed them to key Cabinet posts.
zh: 首相任命他们担任内阁要职。

en: The Prime Minister is feeling the heat over his statement.
zh: 首相因他的声明而感到压力。

en: The Prime Minister was obliged to resign from the Cabinet.
zh: 首相被迫辞去内阁职务。

en: The prime minister hinted at the possibility of an early election.
zh: 首相暗示有可能提前举行选举。

en: The Prime Minister was unable to form a Cabinet.
zh: 首相未能组建内阁。

en: The Prime Minister announced that he would resign within a few weeks.
zh: 首相宣布他将在几周内辞职。

en: The Prime Minister is invested with incredible powers.
zh: 首相被赋予了令人难以置信的权力。

en: The Prime Minister has won his services as Minister for Justice.
zh: 首相赢得了他担任司法部长的服务。

en: The Prime Minister held a press conference yesterday.
zh: 首相昨天举行了新闻发布会。

en: The Prime Minister dwelt upon the financial crisis.
zh: 首相详细阐述了金融危机。

en: The Prime Minister fell from favor with the people.
zh: 首相失去了人民的拥护。

en: The Prime Minister stated that he would not introduce a new tax without the consensus of public opinion.
zh: 首相表示，如果没有公众舆论的共识，他不会推出新税。

en: The prime minister dissolved the Diet.
zh: 首相解散了国会。

en: The Prime Minister proposed administrative reforms.
zh: 首相提议进行行政改革。

en: The prime minister paid a formal visit to the White House.
zh: 首相正式访问了白宫。

en: The Premier subscribed his name to the charter.
zh: 总理在宪章上署名。

en: The premier announced his intention to undertake drastic reforms in parliament.
zh: 总理宣布他打算在议会进行大刀阔斧的改革。

en: The prime minister fielded some tough questions at the press conference.
zh: 首相在新闻发布会上回答了一些棘手的问题。

en: It is whispered that the Prime Minister is critically ill.
zh: 有传言说首相病危。

en: The premier paid a formal visit to the White House.
zh: 总理正式访问了白宫。

en: The Prime Minister wants to be respected by everybody.
zh: 首相希望得到所有人的尊重。

en: The Prime Minister was involved in a scandal.
zh: 首相卷入了一场丑闻。

en: The premier is likely to resign.
zh: 总理很可能会辞职。

en: Our Prime Minister is scheduled to meet with the Chinese Prime Minister tomorrow.
zh: 我们的首相计划明天会见中国总理。

en: The foreign minister will act for the Prime Minister in his absence.
zh: 外交部长将在首相缺席时代行其职权。

en: The prime minister's remark sparked the opposition movement.
zh: 首相的言论引发了反对运动。

en: The prime minister's answer was equivocal.
zh: 首相的回答模棱两可。

en: The news of the prime minister's resignation took us by surprise.
zh: 首相辞职的消息让我们感到惊讶。

en: The Prime Minister's speech was calculated to anger the opposition parties.
zh: 首相的演讲意在激怒反对党。

en: The prime minister's speech did not make for peace.
zh: 首相的演讲无助于和平。

en: The Prime Minister's explanation of the scandal just wouldn't wash with the public.
zh: 首相对于丑闻的解释根本无法让公众信服。

en: The premier and his cabinet colleagues resigned.
zh: 总理和他的内阁同僚辞职了。

en: Word is passing that the Prime Minister is seriously ill.
zh: 有传言说首相病得很重。

en: The prime minister appoints the members of his cabinet.
zh: 首相任命他的内阁成员。

en: The Prime Minister tried to cover up the scandal, but that just made it worse when the newspapers discovered the truth.
zh: 首相试图掩盖丑闻，但这只会让报纸发现真相后情况变得更糟。

en: I sprained my neck while sleeping.
zh: 我睡觉的时候扭伤了脖子。

en: I woke up with a crick in my neck.
zh: 我醒来时脖子就落枕了。

en: They communicate disapproval by shaking their heads.
zh: 他们通过摇头来表达不满。

en: The sun beat down on our necks and backs.
zh: 太阳猛烈地照射着我们的脖子和背部。

en: I'm up to my neck in work.
zh: 我工作忙得不可开交。

en: His head nodded, and he snored gently.
zh: 他点了点头，轻轻地打着鼾。

en: I have a rash on my neck.
zh: 我的脖子上长了皮疹。

en: No one dares to contradict his employer for fear of being fired.
zh: 没有人敢反驳他的雇主，因为害怕被解雇。

en: I can't turn my neck, because it hurts a lot.
zh: 我不能转动脖子，因为它很痛。

en: Don't drive under the influence of alcohol.
zh: 不要酒后驾车。

en: Don't drink and drive.
zh: 不要酒后驾车。

en: Don't drive under the influence of drink.
zh: 不要酒后驾车。

en: I bought a bottle of beer at the liquor store.
zh: 我在酒店买了瓶啤酒。

en: Drink less and sleep more.
zh: 少喝酒，多睡觉。

en: It is a toss-up whether to drink sake or whiskey; too much of either results equally in drunken revelry.
zh: 喝日本清酒还是威士忌，真是难以决定；喝多了都会同样地醉酒狂欢。

en: I advise you to give up drinking.
zh: 我建议你戒酒。

en: Try to be moderate in drinking.
zh: 尽量适量饮酒。

en: Too much drinking will make you sick.
zh: 喝太多酒会让你生病。

en: He was sitting drinking wine.
zh: 他正坐着喝酒。

en: I drank too much and was unsteady on my feet.
zh: 我喝多了，站都站不稳。

en: If he continues drinking too much, he will fall ill sooner or later.
zh: 如果他继续酗酒，迟早会生病的。

en: Both drinking and smoking are bad for the health.
zh: 喝酒和吸烟都对健康有害。

en: Both drinking and smoking are bad for your health.
zh: 喝酒和吸烟都对你的健康有害。

en: We make sake from rice.
zh: 我们用米酿清酒。

en: It's best to drink in moderation.
zh: 最好适量饮酒。

en: The drunken man grasped my collar and swore at me.
zh: 那个醉汉抓住我的衣领，对我破口大骂。

en: Bacchus has drowned more men than Neptune.
zh: 酒神淹死的人比海神还多。

en: Don't indulge yourself too much in drinking.
zh: 不要沉溺于饮酒。

en: You must not get drowned in your sake.
zh: 你不能沉迷于酒。

en: Drink brought about his downfall.
zh: 酗酒导致了他的垮台。

en: Let's have a drink or something.
zh: 我们喝一杯或者什么的吧。

en: When the wine is in, the wit is out.
zh: 酒入愁肠，化作胡言。

en: When wine is in, truth is out.
zh: 酒后吐真言。

en: Where the drink goes in, there the wit goes out.
zh: 酒入愁肠，化作胡言。

en: You must not yield to your desire to drink.
zh: 你不能屈服于饮酒的欲望。

en: He who loves not wine, woman and songs, remains a fool his whole life long.
zh: 不爱酒、女人和歌的人，终生都是个傻瓜。

en: Hobbies take your mind off the worries of everyday life.
zh: 爱好能让你从日常生活的烦恼中解脱出来。

en: There is no disputing about tastes.
zh: 人各有所好，趣味无争。

en: What do you do for fun?
zh: 你有什么爱好？

en: What's your hobby?
zh: 你的爱好是什么？

en: What are your hobbies?
zh: 你的爱好是什么？

en: What is your hobby?
zh: 你的爱好是什么？

en: My hobby is playing golf.
zh: 我的爱好是打高尔夫球。

en: I play the guitar in my spare time.
zh: 我空闲的时候弹吉他。

en: When talking about his hobby, he always puts on a serious expression.
zh: 当谈到他的爱好时，他总是摆出一副严肃的表情。

en: It is not easy to combine hobbies with profits.
zh: 将爱好与利益结合起来并不容易。

en: Speaking of hobbies, I'm fond of baseball.
zh: 说到爱好，我喜欢棒球。

en: Speaking of hobbies, do you collect stamps?
zh: 说到爱好，你集邮吗？

en: If one does not have a hobby, his life may be desolate.
zh: 如果一个人没有爱好，他的生活可能会很荒凉。

en: The seeds will become flowers in the summer.
zh: 夏天，种子会变成花朵。

en: As you sow, so will you reap.
zh: 种瓜得瓜，种豆得豆。

en: Cover the seeds with a little earth.
zh: 用少许泥土覆盖种子。

en: Seeds must have air and water to grow.
zh: 种子必须有空气和水才能生长。

en: The hunter was alert to every sound and movement.
zh: 猎人对每一个声音和动作都保持警惕。

en: The hunters trailed the deer over the mountain.
zh: 猎人们在山上追踪鹿。

en: Spring over the ground like a hunting hound.
zh: 像猎犬一样在地面上跳跃。

en: He who touches pitch shall be defiled therewith.
zh: 常在河边走，哪有不湿鞋。

en: Wounded bears are usually very dangerous.
zh: 受伤的熊通常非常危险。

en: Magicians use deception.
zh: 魔术师使用欺骗手段。

en: No matter how interesting magic shows may be, I don't like them so much.
zh: 无论魔术表演多么有趣，我都不太喜欢它们。

en: He works fast and is very articulate but his insincerity is his biggest defect.
zh: 他工作速度快，口齿伶俐，但他最大的缺点是不真诚。

en: I read novels at random.
zh: 我随意地阅读小说。

en: You had better stop buying things at random.
zh: 你最好不要再随意买东西了。

en: It is better to read a few books carefully than to read many at random.
zh: 与其随意地读很多书，不如认真地读几本书。

en: I helped her into a gown.
zh: 我帮她穿上长袍。

en: It's very nice of you to help me.
zh: 你真好，谢谢你帮助我。

en: Let me do this.
zh: 让我来做这件事。

en: Will you please help me?
zh: 请你帮我好吗？

en: I gave him three textbooks in exchange for his help.
zh: 我给了他三本教科书来换取他的帮助。

en: Do you want me to give you a hand?
zh: 你需要我帮你忙吗？

en: I'll treat you to dinner if you help me.
zh: 如果你帮我，我请你吃晚饭。

en: We need someone to help us.
zh: 我们需要人来帮助我们。

en: Can you help me? I can't make out how to start this machine.
zh: 你能帮我吗？我弄不清楚怎么启动这台机器。

en: I'd like to treat you to lunch to thank you for all your help.
zh: 我想请你吃午饭，感谢你给我的所有帮助。

en: Can I help?
zh: 我能帮忙吗？

en: Do you want me to help?
zh: 需要我帮忙吗？

en: You don't have to help me.
zh: 你不必帮我。

en: Let me help you. Your bag looks very heavy.
zh: 我来帮你吧。你的包看起来很重。

en: Let me give you a hand.
zh: 让我帮你一把。

en: I bought him a drink in return for his help.
zh: 我请他喝了一杯，作为对他帮助的回报。

en: I bought him a drink to thank him for his help.
zh: 我请他喝了一杯，感谢他对我的帮助。

en: Will you lend me the books by Osame Tezuka for about a week?
zh: 你可以把手冢治虫的书借给我大约一个星期吗？

en: Would you write your name in my notebook?
zh: 你能在我的笔记本上写下你的名字吗？

en: That's it in brief.
zh: 简而言之，就是这样。

en: To put it briefly, she turned down his proposal.
zh: 简单来说，她拒绝了他的求婚。

en: To make a long story short, we cannot accept your offer.
zh: 长话短说，我们不能接受你的提议。

en: The project, in short, was a failure.
zh: 总之，这个项目失败了。

en: To put it briefly it's your fault.
zh: 简而言之，这是你的错。

en: To make a long story short, we buried the hatchet.
zh: 长话短说，我们和解了。

en: Please confine yourself to a short comment.
zh: 请你简单评论一下。

en: A pair of gloves is a nice gift.
zh: 一副手套是不错的礼物。

en: I'd like to check in.
zh: 我想办理入住。

en: I got out of bed and had a good stretch.
zh: 我起床后好好地伸了个懒腰。

en: My hands and legs are swollen.
zh: 我的手和腿都肿了。

en: My hands and feet have got as cold as ice.
zh: 我的手脚冰凉。

en: I am interested in palm reading.
zh: 我对看手相感兴趣。

en: Pull it open.
zh: 拉开它。

en: Is there a handling charge?
zh: 有手续费吗？

en: How much is the commission?
zh: 佣金是多少？

en: How much is the handling charge?
zh: 手续费是多少？

en: We charge a commission of 3%.
zh: 我们收取3%的佣金。

en: Learn a trade.
zh: 学一门手艺。

en: I will be happy to assist whoever needs help.
zh: 我乐意帮助任何需要帮助的人。

en: Written by hand, the letter was not very easy to read.
zh: 这封信是手写的，不太容易读。

en: Let's do this as a first step.
zh: 我们先把这件事做了。

en: Her condition is taking a turn for the better after the operation.
zh: 手术后她的情况正在好转。

en: Her condition is improving after the operation.
zh: 手术后她的情况正在改善。

en: I am still a bit sore after my operation.
zh: 手术后我仍然有点疼。

en: Will surgery help it?
zh: 手术能有帮助吗？

en: You have to have an operation.
zh: 你必须做手术。

en: The operation cannot wait.
zh: 手术不能等了。

en: I don't want to have an operation.
zh: 我不想做手术。

en: He had an injection prior to the operation.
zh: 他在手术前打了一针。

en: Do I need an operation?
zh: 我需要做手术吗？

en: Surgery is the best solution.
zh: 手术是最好的解决方案。

en: I converted my yen into dollars.
zh: 我把日元换成了美元。

en: I have no money with me.
zh: 我身上没带钱。

en: Write me sometime, OK?
zh: 有空给我写信，好吗？

en: Please remember to post the letter.
zh: 请记得把信寄出去。

en: Please don't forget to put the letter into the mailbox.
zh: 请不要忘记把信放到邮箱里。

en: As soon as she read the letter, she began to cry.
zh: 她一读到那封信，就开始哭了。

en: Please send the letter by express.
zh: 请用快递寄这封信。

en: Do you think I should write?
zh: 你觉得我应该写信吗？

en: The best way to write letters is to put down whatever is in your mind.
zh: 写信最好的方式就是把你心里想的都写下来。

en: Don't forget to write to me.
zh: 别忘了给我写信。

en: All you have to do in writing is to keep it clear and interesting.
zh: 写作时，你所要做的就是保持清晰和有趣。

en: It is no easy task to write a letter.
zh: 写信不是一件容易的事。

en: I wonder whether to write or phone.
zh: 我在想是写信还是打电话。

en: I've finished writing the letter.
zh: 我已经写完信了。

en: After I write the letter, I'll mail it in a mailbox.
zh: 我写完信后，会把它寄到邮箱里。

en: I have to write a letter, but I won't be able to get at it until tomorrow.
zh: 我得写一封信，但要到明天才能写。

en: Please wait until I have finished writing this letter.
zh: 请等我写完这封信。

en: I'm busy with writing letters and giving speeches.
zh: 我忙于写信和发表演讲。

en: If you have written the letter, I'll post it.
zh: 如果你写好了信，我就去寄。

en: I forgot to put on the stamp before I mailed the letter.
zh: 我忘了在寄信前贴上邮票。

en: Please remind me to post the letters.
zh: 请提醒我把信寄出去。

en: I remember that a letter is sent.
zh: 我记得有一封信被寄出去了。

en: I remember mailing the letter.
zh: 我记得寄过那封信。

en: Let me hear from you.
zh: 给我来信。

en: Please send me a letter.
zh: 请给我寄一封信。

en: You must not write a letter with a pencil.
zh: 你一定不能用铅笔写信。

en: The letter will arrive tomorrow.
zh: 信明天会到。

en: Letters are delivered every day.
zh: 每天都有信件送达。

en: The letter was written by her.
zh: 这封信是她写的。

en: Did you receive my letter?
zh: 你收到我的信了吗？

en: The letter was written.
zh: 这封信写好了。

en: Letters are a link with friends who live far away.
zh: 书信是与远方朋友联系的纽带。

en: The letter will arrive in a week or so.
zh: 信大约一周左右会到。

en: Write your letters with a pen.
zh: 用钢笔写信。

en: I used to type my letters, but now I use a word processor.
zh: 我过去用打字机打信，但现在我用文字处理器。

en: Don't put off answering the letter.
zh: 不要拖延回信。

en: I've got no answer to my letter.
zh: 我的信没有回音。

en: Have you had an answer?
zh: 你收到回复了吗？

en: Have you received an answer to your letter?
zh: 你收到我的信的回复了吗？

en: The letter runs as follows.
zh: 信的内容如下。

en: The contents of the letter were secret.
zh: 信的内容是秘密。

en: Her duties include making copies of letters.
zh: 她的职责包括复印信件。

en: Don't forget to put a stamp on your letter.
zh: 别忘了在信上贴邮票。

en: You must reply to that letter.
zh: 你必须回复那封信。

en: You have to reply to the letter.
zh: 你必须回复这封信。

en: Please contact me by letter.
zh: 请写信联系我。

en: Please contact me by mail.
zh: 请通过邮件联系我。

en: Drop me a line and let me know what you think.
zh: 给我写封信，告诉我你的想法。

en: Treated roughly, the cup has some cracks.
zh: 因为粗暴对待，这个杯子有些裂缝。

en: We should take the necessary steps before it's too late.
zh: 我们应该在为时过晚之前采取必要的措施。

en: We have ample funds in hand.
zh: 我们手头有充足的资金。

en: Watch your fingers!
zh: 小心你的手指！

en: This is all the money I have.
zh: 这是我所有的钱。

en: Let's make believe we have one million yen hand.
zh: 我们假装我们有一百万日元在手。

en: The bill is due on the 1st of next month.
zh: 账单下个月1号到期。

en: Where are the luggage carts?
zh: 行李车在哪里？

en: I will be waiting for you at baggage claim.
zh: 我会在行李领取处等你。

en: Where do I go after I pick up my baggage?
zh: 我取完行李后该去哪里？

en: Where can I check my baggage?
zh: 我在哪里可以托运行李？

en: This is all my carry-on baggage.
zh: 这些都是我的随身行李。

en: We limit baggage to ten kilograms each.

en: I have to charge the battery of my car.
zh: 我得给我的汽车电池充电了。

en: The car battery is dead.
zh: 汽车电池没电了。

en: My car battery is dead.
zh: 我的汽车电池没电了。

en: I was unable to write down the number of the car.
zh: 我没能记下那辆车的车牌号。

en: Military personnel are prime targets of car salespeople.
zh: 军人是汽车销售员的主要目标。

en: I have a problem with my car.
zh: 我的车有点问题。

en: Instead of putting the car into gear, she put it into reverse, causing a great deal of damage to the store-front.
zh: 她没有把车挂到前进挡，而是挂到了倒挡，对店面造成了很大的损坏。

en: I've lost my car key.
zh: 我把我的车钥匙弄丢了。

en: I can't get the car to start.
zh: 我没法启动汽车。

en: The car failing to start, we went by bus.
zh: 因为汽车无法启动，我们只好坐公交车去了。

en: I narrowly escaped being run over by a car.
zh: 我差点被汽车撞到。

en: I was almost hit by a car.
zh: 我差点被车撞了。

en: I spend all her money on the car.
zh: 她把所有的钱都花在了汽车上。

en: Don't you have a phone in your car?
zh: 你的车里没有电话吗？

en: Look out for the car.
zh: 小心汽车。

en: I asked if you wanted a ride.
zh: 我问你要不要搭车。

en: Get into the car.
zh: 上车吧。

en: I was wondering if you could give me a lift.
zh: 我想知道你是否能载我一程。

en: Will you give me a ride?
zh: 你能载我一程吗？

en: Could you give me a lift in your car?
zh: 你能开车送我一程吗？

en: I'll give you a lift.
zh: 我载你一程。

en: Why don't you give me a ride?
zh: 你为什么不载我一程呢？

en: Can I give you a ride?
zh: 我可以载你一程吗？

en: I signaled the car to go slow.
zh: 我示意汽车开慢点。

en: Didn't you lock up your car?
zh: 你没锁车吗？

en: I'll give you a ride.
zh: 我载你一程。

en: Is there any room to spare in your car?
zh: 你的车里还有空位吗？

en: Lots of people are interested in cars, but they're really nothing to me.
zh: 很多人对汽车感兴趣，但对我来说没什么特别的。

en: Could you carry it to the car?
zh: 你能把它搬到车上吗？

en: Nothing is the matter with the car. It's just that you are a bad driver.
zh: 车子没问题，只是你开车技术不好。

en: There was room for one person in the car.
zh: 车里还有一个人的位置。

en: A car has one steering wheel.
zh: 汽车有一个方向盘。

en: It was careless of you to leave the key in the car.
zh: 你把钥匙留在车里太粗心了。

en: When I passed by it in a car, I caught a glimpse of the house of a famous actress.
zh: 我开车经过时，瞥见了那位著名女演员的房子。

en: I caught a glimpse of the house of a famous actress when I passed by it in a car.
zh: 我开车经过时，瞥见了那位著名女演员的房子。

en: Let's go by car.
zh: 我们开车去吧。

en: My neck snapped when my car was hit from behind.
zh: 我的车被追尾时，我的脖子扭到了。

en: Please come to pick me up.
zh: 请来接我。

en: He went to Kyoto by car.
zh: 他开车去了京都。

en: I went to Kyoto by car.
zh: 我开车去了京都。

en: I've been to the seaside by car.
zh: 我开车去过海边。

en: Will you drive me home?
zh: 你能开车送我回家吗？

en: Another ten minutes drive will take you to the seashore.
zh: 再开十分钟就到海边了。

en: Could you tell me how to get to your office?
zh: 请问你办公室怎么走？

en: How long does it take by car?
zh: 开车要多久？

en: It only takes thirty minutes by car.
zh: 开车只要三十分钟。

en: It took me an hour and a half to get there by car.
zh: 我开车去那里花了一个半小时。

en: I want a car, but I have no money to buy one.
zh: 我想要一辆车，但我没钱买。

en: I want a car, but I don't have money to buy one.
zh: 我想要一辆车，但我没钱买。

en: The car bumped the tree.
zh: 车撞到了树。

en: A car went by at terrific speed.
zh: 一辆汽车飞速驶过。

en: There were cars burning, people dying, and nobody could help them.
zh: 到处都是燃烧的汽车，死去的人们，却没有人能帮助他们。

en: It was frightful when my car skidded on the ice.
zh: 我的车在冰上打滑，太可怕了。

en: A car was blocking the gateway.
zh: 一辆汽车堵住了大门。

en: Each passing car threw up a cloud of dust.
zh: 每辆经过的汽车都扬起一阵尘土。

en: The passing car splashed muddy water on me.
zh: 经过的汽车溅了我一身泥水。

en: A car drew up at the main gate.
zh: 一辆汽车停在了大门口。

en: Cars took the place of bicycles.
zh: 汽车取代了自行车。

en: He would still be alive if he had been wearing his seat belt when the car crashed.
zh: 如果车祸发生时他系着安全带，他现在还活着。

en: Cars arrived there one after another.
zh: 汽车一辆接一辆地到达那里。

en: We were stuck for hours in a traffic jam.
zh: 我们被堵在路上好几个小时。

en: I was late because my car broke down.
zh: 我迟到了，因为我的车坏了。

en: The car broke down, so that we had to walk.
zh: 车坏了，所以我们不得不步行。

en: My car broke down, so I had to take a bus.
zh: 我的车坏了，所以我不得不坐公交车。

en: Something must be wrong with our car; the engine is giving off smoke.
zh: 我们的车一定有问题；发动机冒烟了。

en: The car broke down on the way to the airport.
zh: 车在去机场的路上坏了。

en: The car left a cloud of dust behind it.
zh: 汽车留下了一团尘土。

en: The car broke down, so they had to walk.
zh: 车坏了，所以他们不得不走路。

en: I heard a car stop in front of the house.
zh: 我听到一辆车停在房子前面。

en: She had a narrow escape when her car skidded off the road into a lake.
zh: 她的车打滑冲到湖里，她侥幸逃脱。

en: His car broke down in remote countryside.
zh: 他的车在偏远的乡村抛锚了。

en: A car was coming in this direction.
zh: 一辆车正朝这个方向开来。

en: There is ample room for another car.
zh: 这里有足够的空间再停一辆车。

en: Do you want a car?
zh: 你需要车吗？

en: The car hit the fence and turned over.
zh: 车撞到栅栏并翻了过来。

en: The car got stuck in the mud.
zh: 车陷在泥里了。

en: We couldn't go there because we didn't have a car.
zh: 我们去不了那里，因为我们没有车。

en: The car collided with a truck.
zh: 这辆车和一辆卡车相撞了。

en: The car crashed into the truck.
zh: 这辆车撞到了卡车上。

en: The car banged itself against a tree.
zh: 车撞到树上了。

en: We shouldn't have any trouble if the traffic isn't too heavy.
zh: 如果交通不太拥堵，我们应该不会有什么麻烦。

en: I couldn't get out of my garage because there was a car in the way.
zh: 我出不了车库，因为有辆车挡住了路。

en: There's a car coming.
zh: 有辆车过来了。

en: They would have been killed if the car had gone over the cliff.
zh: 如果车掉下悬崖，他们就没命了。

en: They would've been killed if the car had gone over the cliff.
zh: 如果车掉下悬崖，他们就没命了。

en: They'd have been killed if the car had gone over the cliff.
zh: 如果车掉下悬崖，他们就没命了。

en: How I wish I had a car.
zh: 我多么希望我有一辆车啊。

en: We can go there with the help of a car.
zh: 我们可以借助汽车去那里。

en: If you have a car, you can come and go at will.
zh: 如果你有车，你就可以随意来去。

en: Why do you walk when you have a car?
zh: 你有车为什么还要走路呢？

en: I wish I had a car.
zh: 我希望我有一辆车。

en: A car cut in.
zh: 一辆车插队了。
